content:
Hi All,

I couldn't help but notice this tutorial at this week's WGM in Cologne on Wednesday
1:45 - 5pm : Understanding and Using Terminology in HL7 FHIR.
Is there any chance of getting the slides for this? Or better still a link to a video to benefit those, like myself that are unable to attend? There are some areas of using terminology in FHIR that I am uncertain of, hence my interest in this tutorial. Apologies in advance if this is not the appropriate "stream" to post this query on, but it seems to be one of the most active, hence I am posting this here.
@Rob Hausam ? (You could have posted in #terminology but any queries about training are always in-scope for #implementers :))
@John George You might also check out the FHIR DevDays website - there are videos and slides from previous years' talks on FHIR Terminology Services

Hi @Michael Lawley , many thanks for the pointer to the FHIR DevDays website.. I found what I needed: <https://www.slideshare.net/DevDays/fhir-dev-daysadvancedfhirterminologyservices-82201320?qid=bf3bc31d-25a2-43a4-98b7-8df9de8edf90&v=&b=&from_search=2> Brilliant, many thanks for sharing this, much appreciated.
Apologies for missing this topic earlier, but in case they're still helpful here is the link to the terminology tutorial slides in Cologne.
